questions.question: Which phrase is the best clue that the poem’s speaker is a child?

choices.answer: “Life doesn’t frighten me at all”
“I can walk the ocean floor”
“Mean old Mother Goose”
“Tough guys in a fight”

questions.question: Which of these is a fear of something real?

choices.answer: a fear of “Noises down the hall”
a fear of “Big ghosts in a cloud”
a fear of “Mean old Mother Goose”
a fear of “Dragons breathing flame”

questions.question: Which of these is a fear of something imaginary?

choices.answer: a fear of “Shadows on the wall”
a fear of “Bad dogs barking loud”
a fear of being “All alone at night”
a fear of “Dragons breathing flame”

questions.question: What do the words “make them shoo” mean?

choices.answer: make them cry
make them go away
make them come closer
make them laugh

questions.question: What do the lines “I won’t cry / So they fly” tell you about the speaker?

choices.answer: The speaker is not scared of the things in the poem.
The speaker is scared of birds.
The speaker is too scared to cry.
The speaker cannot fly.

questions.question: An important idea in the poem is

choices.answer: going to school every day.
being afraid of animals.
using your imagination.
getting enough sleep.

questions.question: Which lines most clearly show that the speaker is probably a girl?

choices.answer: “Mean old Mother Goose / Lions on the loose”
“I make fun / Way they run”
“I go boo / Make them shoo”
“That new classroom where / Boys all pull my hair”

questions.question: The lines ”If I’m afraid at all / It’s only in my dreams” emphasize that the speaker

choices.answer: is brave in the face of danger.
is brave only when asleep.
is scared of waking up.
is tired and needs to rest.

questions.question: The poem’s theme focuses on the importance of

choices.answer: going to school.
imagining scary things.
dealing with our fears.
learning how to swim.

questions.question: Which of these lines have the most serious tone, or feeling?

choices.answer: “Bad dogs barking loud / Big ghosts in a cloud”
“Tough guys in a fight / All alone at night”
“I just smile / They go wild”
“I go boo / Make them shoo”

a pattern of rhymes at the ends of lines
a group of two or more lines that form a unit

the voice that "talks" to the reader

is a technique where a sound, word, or phrase is repeated
a group of two or more lines that form a unit in a poem
the use of words whose sounds echo their meanings

repetition of consonant sounds at the beginning of words
the use of words whose sounds echo their meanings
repetition of consonant sounds at the beginning of words
a couple of people
a rhymed pair of lines
repetition of consonant sounds at the beginning of words
trash on the ground
a group of two or more lines that form a unit in a poem
a rhymed pair of lines
a pattern of rhymes at the end of lines (aaabba)
a rhymed pair of lines (I make fun/ Way they run)
using words whose sounds echo the meanings (pop, bang, whiz)
